attributes.action: Hold a Commons debate on whether the UK should introduce a statutory AI law.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has no statutory AI law. Government relies on existing rules, regulators and the AI Security Institute. AI systems already influence decisions in work, education, housing, finance and services. A Commons debate is needed to consider whether the UK should move from a voluntary approach to a clear and accountable statutory framework.
attributes.background: Hold a House of Commons debate on introducing a statutory AI framework. The debate should draw on relevant parliamentary work on AI to help shape a clear and consistent national approach to regulating AI across the UK.

departments.name: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

rejection.details:
We are not clear what specific action you are seeking in regards to a law on AI.

You could submit a new petition setting out more clearly what you like an AI Act to cover.
